result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan James Espie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan James Espie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dylan James Espie was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan James Espie

11:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dylan James Espie in court without counsel. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CM8, 21TR5715

State - there is an agreement, deft will enter plea to Ct 2 - courts of $463, moves to dismiss Ct 1, will enter plea to 21TR5715 - fine of $866.50, 6 month rev of DL, AODA and DSP
Court - speaks to deft's right to counsel
Deft - waives counsel
Court - reads charges and max penalties

Deft - enters a guilty plea to Ct 2 of 22CM8 and a guilty plea to 21TR5715, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts guilty pleas and finds defendant guilty 

State - asks Court to follow agreement
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court orders:
Ct 2 of 22CM8 - deft to pay court costs of $463
21TR5715 - deft to pay fine of $866.50, 6 month revocation of DL, complete an AODA assessment and driver's safety plan

Dismissed: Ct 1 of 22CM8
